Application.Name: FanBridge
Application.Overview:
FanBridge – bridge Unraid drive temperatures to an external microcontroller (Arduino/RP2040) over USB serial to control PWM fans.
Unprivileged by default: map your serial device as a Device (by-id path recommended) and optionally expose /dev/serial/by-id (ro) for stable symlinks.

Config.Name: AppData (config)
Config.Description: Container configuration directory. Persist settings and user data here.

Config.Name: Unraid emhttp directory (read-only)
Config.Description: Bind the full emhttp directory (preferred). Ensures updates to disks.ini are visible instantly inside the container. Optional — if not mapped, the app runs without drive data.

Config.Name: USB by-id directory (optional, ro)
Config.Description: Expose stable udev by-id symlinks for USB serial devices. Recommended for persistent device naming. Optional — safe to leave unset.

Config.Name: (Advanced) disks.ini only (ro)
Config.Description: Bind only disks.ini (not recommended). Optional — if not mapped, the app runs without drive data. Prefer mapping the directory above.

Config.Name: Serial TTY Device
Config.Description: Optional. Recommended device: /dev/ttyACM0 (RP2040). Map your USB serial device when connected; leave this blank by default so the container starts even if the device is unplugged.

Config.Name: Preferred serial port
Config.Description: Defaults to /dev/ttyACM0 (RP2040). Optional: set a stable by-id path (requires mapping /dev/serial/by-id:ro).

Config.Name: Serial baud
Config.Description: Baud rate used for the microcontroller connection.

Config.Name: Secure cookies (HTTPS)
Config.Description: Set to 1 when serving the UI over HTTPS behind a reverse proxy to mark cookies as Secure.
